definition: enemy/to be a match for/to rival/to resist/to withstand

sentences.english: “The two invaders appear to be equally matched.”, ” Moffett says.
sentences.chinese: 這兩幫侵略者看來勢均力敵。
那是一場勢均力敵的比賽。

sentences.english: And that head-to-head race ends on Election Day when the voters cast their ballots.
sentences.chinese: 而這場勢均力敵的競賽將在總統大選日結束。

sentences.english: But the old man had raised his hand up to dead even again.
sentences.chinese: 但老人又把手扳回來，恢復勢均力敵的局面。

sentences.english: The well-matched tennis players fought a long, close battle.
sentences.chinese: 兩名棋逢對手的網球選手打了一場勢均力敵的長仗。

sentences.english: Evenly matched opponents every game will produce the United States.
sentences.chinese: 勢均力敵，賽逢對手纔會產生美。

sentences.english: The defensive team nearly equipoised the offensive team.
sentences.chinese: 守隊與攻隊幾乎是勢均力敵。

sentences.english: The two football teams are level-pegging at the moment.
sentences.chinese: 兩個足球隊此時勢均力敵。

definition: to turn white-hot/to intensify/to reach a climax
lit. two armies have equivalent banners and drums (idiom); fig. evenly matched/roughly comparable (opponents)
peer competition/to function as rivals/to make claims as an equal
to face off against one's adversary (military, sports etc)
to face an attack/to repulse the enemy
to fight with all one's might
to follow up a victory and press home the attack/to pursue retreating enemy
